intro: Tylophora celebica, commonly known as the Celebes tylophora, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes plants with milky sap and often toxic compounds. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or greenish in color. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
